Shokaract looks right to the Maximal base. He laughs and brings up his
gattling gun. He fires 3 missiles (one from each barrel) at the base...

----- Original Message -----
From: "FIRE FOX" <firefox_y2k@...>
To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, January 09, 2001 6:27 PM
Subject: Re: Battle at the CF


> (I think I have the hang of this now. I'm glad your feeling better Yan^_^
> Oh, and Ks, just to make sure you know, the bridge is still under
lockdown.
> Absolutely no computers or access panels are visible or accessible[sp].
> Sorry this is so long, but it's either type this or do homework...)
>
> Hysteria/Tavatron
>
> Tavatron sent a sickle shaped wave of energy at Manterror. Iron Raptor
could
> take care of herself, as she had already proven. Kluster, however, seemed
in
> need of assistance.
>
> *****
>
> Hysteria:
>
> Hysteria cringed slightly as she slowly pulled herself into a sitting
> position. Her armor was charred, and her gears groaned and sparked
everytime
> she moved. Right now, however, her condition was of little importance. The
> Alliance 'bots were slowly nearing the bridge. It was under lockdown, but
> she had no knowledge of their weaponry or technical abilities. The
> flamethrowers that had been firing at Unitron and Firestarter had
exploded.
>
> Hysteria's laptop was in small pieces scattered throughout the ventilation
> shaft. Her interface cord, however, was still operational. She plugged it
in
> to the nearest access panel and checked the status of the CF. The shields
> were at 45% and something was happening to the doors. Further inspection
> revealed a weakening of their molecular level. She didn't know whether to
> blast it or just leave them alone for the time being.
>
> She chose to ignore them and worry about more pressing matters, such as
> Firestarter and Unitron. Firestarter's missiles dented the thick door
> barring his entrence, and left a large black mark where they struck.
> Hysteria's scanners indicated that in the Brig four 'bots were attempting
> escape. She charged the undamaged autoguns on the far wall and fired
> multiple rounds at Demolition and anyone else who happened to be out of
> their cell:
>
> "This isn't going to work!"
>
> The shields were already fluctuating and more weapon's fire was heading
> their way. After the final missile struck the shield read 20% and failing.
> One more blast like the last one and the shields would be nonexistant,
> again.
>
> CF Comp: *Alert! Weapon's fire detected within proximity of unit Hysteria*
>
> Hysteria quickly fired a blast from her left wrist cannon at the oncoming
> missile. The resounding blast shook the vent and sent Hysteria tumbling
down
> an access shaft. She landed hard in another part of the ship after falling
> about 100 nearly vertical feet, taking a few involuntary turns, and nearly
> crashing in to the vent walls:
>
> "*groan* Where the slag am I?"
>
> A pulsating sound to her right was all she needed to hear to know she was
in
> the CF's engine room. Hysteria looked up at the massive propulsion system
of
> the mighty ship. Maybe, just maybe...
>
> Hysteria jumped to her feet, ignoring the pain that shot through her body.
> She limped/ran to the large console beside the engine. Since it was
located
> in the heart of the ship the engine room was virtually undamaged. If she
> could reroute the power from the propulsion system it would be enough to
> power the shields and the EMP cannon! But it would also destroy any chance
> they had of getting off the planet. She couldn't contact Kluster because
of
> damage sustained by her comm. She had no choice. Hysteria typed in several
> passwords, her fingers flying across the console as she feverishly worked
to
> save what little remained of the CF.
> _________________________________________________________________

>
>
>
>
